channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic lights sequence is too quick for the speed limit of the road, 3rd July
item.description:
Driving on the legal speed limit towards barnwood, the traffic lights changed so quickly to red that heavy braking was required. There is absolutely no need to change so quickly, it is dangerous. Slow the sequence down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brambles overgrowing footpath, 3rd July
item.description:
It's time to trim back the brambles that grow out over the path through to the bus stop on the A40 please. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Campden Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham

item.title: 300 yard sign missing, 3rd July
item.description:
The 300 yard to junction exit sign is missing and appears to have been so for a number of weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury

item.title: Over grown hedge, 3rd July
item.description:
Right on the corner of st michaels avenue is a very big and wide hedge which is hard to get past and attracting wasps my self children and my dog have been stung as you have to get so close to the hedge
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Michaels Avenue, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedges brambles nettles, 2nd July
item.description:
It is becoming increasingly difficult to drive to my home due to the overgrown verges once again. It is the end of Gravel Walk leading into Southam Lane. It is an ongoing issue every year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Walk, Southam, Cheltenham

item.title: Fly tipping, 2nd July
item.description:
The fly tipping is as you come into Millfield, the first field on your left walk to the bottom through the trees, and it’s about 20 foot on your left

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Larkhay Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Potholes recently filled, 1st July
item.description:
They filled a couple but missed most of the other 20. The only way to avoid the bumps is to drive on the opposite side of the road (if there is nothing coming) As it is a bus route you would expect a level of priority but the time this has been dangerous is beyond a joke. Been like this for over 6 months

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East End Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discarded paving slab outside house, 30th June
item.description:

item.title: Trees over grown, 30th June
item.description:
When getting out the junction it is hard to see the road ahead as overgrown trees and bushes in the way. Plus with parked cars too close to the junction it’s making it harder to see clearly getting out. It has over grown over the metal railing and onto footpath. All that area has overgrown and not been cut down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Meadow Close, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
